subsection.name: Description
subsection.div: Checks specified tokens text for matching an illegal pattern. By default, no tokens are specified.

tr.td: Define the RegExp for illegal pattern.
Control whether to ignore case when matching.
Define the message which is used to notify about violations; if empty then the default message is used.

subset of tokens
NUM_DOUBLE , NUM_FLOAT , NUM_INT , NUM_LONG , IDENT , COMMENT_CONTENT , STRING_LITERAL , CHAR_LITERAL , TEXT_BLOCK_CONTENT .

subsection.name: Examples
subsection.p: To configure the check to forbid String literals containing "a href":

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="IllegalTokenText"> <property name="tokens" value="STRING_LITERAL"/> <property name="format" value="a href"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to forbid String literals containing "a href" for the ignoreCase mode:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="IllegalTokenText"> <property name="tokens" value="STRING_LITERAL"/> <property name="format" value="a href"/> <property name="ignoreCase" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to forbid string literal text blocks containing ":

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="IllegalTokenText"> <property name="tokens" value="TEXT_BLOCK_CONTENT"/> <property name="format" value='"'/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.p: To configure the check to forbid leading zeros in an integer literal, other than zero and a hex literal:

pre.code: <module name="Checker"> <module name="TreeWalker"> <module name="IllegalTokenText"> <property name="tokens" value="NUM_INT,NUM_LONG"/> <property name="format" value="^0[^lx]"/> <property name="ignoreCase" value="true"/> </module> </module> </module>

subsection.name: Violation Messages
subsection.p: All messages can be customized if the default message doesn't suit you. Please see the documentation to learn how to.
